column5: There are so many variables within this question. It‚Äôs impossible to answer. For a year when I was covered by a parent‚Äôs private insurance I paid a $10 copay and saw the therapist weekly. Currently I pay no copay so it‚Äôs free for me. I go weekly now too. Well it‚Äôs Telehealth currently. But these two situations are very different and it‚Äôs possible I live in an area with better access to mental health services.
I support the lawsuit. Animals are family regardless of other people‚Äôs opinions.

NTB. The concern you have for your dogs is not misplaced even if others think so. Some people just don‚Äôt get that dogs are family and separation anxiety is very distressing for them. I think your plan is perfectly fine.
This is the first time I wish I hadn‚Äôt seen what the negative downvotes were about. Wtf
Without context I might be way off. But maybe... learning from mistakes rather than denying mistakes happened?? Big question marks tho, without context.

Read every word and you should be proud! I‚Äôm nearing 40 and haven‚Äôt quite accomplished everything on your list. Just to be clear, it‚Äôs not a competition. I just know how hard some of those accomplishments can be. I‚Äôm proud of my own progress too but I‚Äôm so happy you‚Äôre doing these things much earlier than I was able to.

I agree about a therapist and anger. Also it sounds like everyone is frustrated and the frustration is undermining your worth. Having an addiction doesn‚Äôt make you worthless.  Having an addiction means you have a problem you need to deal with. It‚Äôs pretty easy for too many people to feel ashamed of our problems but we‚Äôre only human and not perfect. You have some good insight since you see the addiction and how it‚Äôs not a good mentality. Use the insight and work with a therapist to find out why you dislike yourself so much. It‚Äôs easier to not dwell on destructive thoughts if you can redirect yourself to you actually enjoy, rather than continuing to avoid something with the addiction. It‚Äôs not easy but it‚Äôs worth it.
Yes, talk to your therapist, OP. It could help you work better together.

Sometimes it gets worse before it gets better. I would normally elaborate in more general ways but I‚Äôm just going to say it‚Äôs totally possible to get to the better. And it‚Äôs completely worth the work. This is my experience. I still have a lot of work to do, including dealing with recently realizing the abuse I endured growing up was waaaaay worse than I was aware. But even with that pile of poop to deal with, things are better. Sorry if I‚Äôm talking about me too much, but I just want to give some hope about therapy. I tried suicide multiple times. Now, I don‚Äôt want to die. Thanks to therapists and other mental health professionals.

I‚Äôm reading my own experience in your situation, OP. So if I‚Äôm way off just disregard.

I‚Äôm sensing the sibling rivalry is a HUGE source of continuing pain and that it is borne from your parent‚Äôs treatment of you and your sister. It‚Äôs only been in the years after my one sibling died that I‚Äôve been seeing clearly how shitty my parents were, and how they were responsible for the rift we felt as siblings. The gaps in favoritisms were hugely in her favorite. With my mom, I was absolutely always wrong when it came to an argument with sis. Well I was wrong at everything according to mom especially, but also dad. 

You gotta deal with it. 

I‚Äôm voting NTA. I‚Äôm fairly certain the remarks you made to your sister were designed to hurt her. I‚Äôll give the benefit of the doubt concerning how you treat your sisters kid when around her. Saying anything to the kid about all this, her existence basically being bad, should be off limits. The kid is innocent.

My own experience of being treated unfairly leaves me thinking the comment was somehow ‚Äúdeserved‚Äù in the sense that favoritism so incredibly toxic and venting a little bit is hard to avoid. But there‚Äôs a point where you - and sis - become accountable for your actions and the attitudes that guide them. You are in large part who you were raised to be, but there‚Äôs a point to claim responsibility and become the person you want to be. Living in anger is not living.

If I‚Äôm right on any counts, please get into therapy. It helps. Maybe r/RaisedByNarcissists would help illuminate some things? I‚Äôm not sure. I‚Äôm just adding it because it‚Äôs recently been helpful for me.
Good job for the hard work

Normal? Idk. But I know I do this sometimes. It used to be a constant thing but it‚Äôs much better for me. I think as I feel better my memory has improved. I still get anxious and depressed but I‚Äôm not constantly having severe mood disturbances anymore. 

I‚Äôm sure your therapist knows you‚Äôre paying attention. She may be able to help you find a way to deal with it like taking a few minutes at the end of the session to recap the conversation.
Lol ü§£ the best to you too.
Oh I wasn‚Äôt taking you literally. Just wanted to say my grrr moments were a little different but I definitely had them. Sorry I wasn‚Äôt clear.

I told my last therapist something like ‚Äúyou‚Äôre usually right but I never want to admit it to you‚Äù ... after a couple years of her being right. I‚Äôm sure she knew tho. Strangle? No. But I had some screaming matches (in my head and directed towards her in a made up conversation) saying I hated she was right and hated her making me face my own bullshit.
I thought the Y might be a P. Like we have silent letters. Could be a silent P.

I agree. I have ocd and I totally saw some of my old patterns too. 

Things will only get better if you tackle the issues. It‚Äôs super scary but when you open up to the right therapist, well, it‚Äôs crazy how much better things can get.

I wish I could say my regrettable behaviors were limited to childhood. I‚Äôm getting close to 40 and I didn‚Äôt start changing until about 10 years ago. Part of me wants to blame it on the level of toxicity I was exposed to, but idk if it‚Äôs accurate. I can‚Äôt remember the exact conversation - but part of the topic had to do with nature vs nurture - when my therapist said ‚Äúbut there‚Äôs a helluva lot of nurture going on.‚Äù Idk
Idk what‚Äôs best, but if you call the cops you can ask if they have an officer who has gone through training specifically for situations involving persons with mental illness.

We learn how to love ourselves by how our parents love us. Or don‚Äôt. I also internalized the shit-talk my mom said about other people. I didn‚Äôt know it wasn‚Äôt ok to make fun of someone for a physical feature they cannot change. Coupled with my memory of me being hateful like my mother is a very deep gratitude for the mental health professionals who have/are helping me be the person underneath my reaction to an abusive world. I‚Äôm finally starting to feel like me for the first time ever.

I‚Äôve heard that it‚Äôs important they not be together 100% of the time. Like so they can be comfortable if separated for some reason. My dad had two labs from the same litter. One was nervous if she didn‚Äôt have the other one to follow around. He was working on trying to get the anxious one out on her own with less anxiety. 

I bet you‚Äôll do great tho. It is a perfect time to get the hardest parts done. Any dog is great at distracting us from human troubles.
Thanks üòä
Just to be clear, I downvoted you because therapists have greatly helped me improve my life *a lot*. I also take it seriously and know I have to do a lot of the work myself.

I live at supportive housing (in a different state) and see a therapist offsite within the same clinic. Non essential workers were also told to stay home in my state. I‚Äôm video chatting from home for therapy, but on-site support staff continue to work as normal with extra precautions in place. I can‚Äôt say any of it applies to you, but that‚Äôs my experience.

Sometimes you can get free or cheap therapy through a church. It‚Äôs not necessarily religious-based, but it‚Äôs an avenue for people to give back to the community. And sometimes nonprofit mental health clinics can give reduced fee or free services also. I don‚Äôt know for sure how you would find them but maybe try googling ‚Äúcommunity mental health‚Äù or some combination of these terms: nonprofit mental health clinic, reduced fee or free counseling. 

Sorry that therapist did that. I‚Äôve been with a non profit clinic for quite a while (as a patient/client) and the providers before the clinic were not great. Not everyone at the clinic is great either, but I‚Äôve been mostly lucky finding ones I could work with. My observation is that therapists who stay at the clinic are often very compassionate and good at what they do. Some just stick around for 2 years for experience after college. The ones that stay really want to help. Just my experience at one clinic. Best wishes.

I like your brick-wall-house imagery. I think I can pull some helpful parts from what you wrote so thank you. I will have to adapt it because my life is of course different. I‚Äôm on disability and unable to work. I don‚Äôt live with my Nmom but she is skilled with using the phone to play her games. I am in therapy and take it seriously and have made tons of progress with myself and also in dealing with Nmom. 

Congrats on improving your own life. I hope your journey is happy as well.

Thanks. I needed the reminder about the accompanying anxiety. I have been diagnosed with ocd and I know how my behavior in the last (10?) years fits the description. I just wonder when it actually started. I don‚Äôt remember my childhood well enough to know if it fits into the actual diagnosis. Thanks for the reply

Going through the process of planning/rescheduling a wedding you don‚Äôt want a second time? So NTB. It‚Äôs for you and your SO. People may not be happy but it‚Äôs totally within your right to do it your way.
Close enough

If cell data is an issue, I read that AT&T is giving extra data this month. I‚Äôm sure other companies are following suit. Hopefully reception isn‚Äôt an issue. Maybe do a test call to a friend at whatever spot you plan to try. Others gave good ideas for places.

Can confirm. I was initially thinking that while OP was NTA, it‚Äôs very possible the kid would receive worse treatment at home as a direct result. Because an(/my) abusive parent would blame the kid for being called out for their own behavior. From reading comments I can see that an abusive parent‚Äôs retaliation in this situation would actually be worth it in the long run. I don‚Äôt remember anyone doing that for me.
Thanks for validating that it‚Äôs necessary and ok. Part of me still doubts it is.
I‚Äôm glad you had the awareness when you were still young. I‚Äôve wasted a lot of time not seeing my Nmom for who she is and then hoping it wasn‚Äôt true or thinking she would change.

Nipples can be seen through bras anyway. Mine are usually alert. I gave up. I don‚Äôt want more padding. I‚Äôm already carrying enough around. 

Side note: on Star Trek Next Generation, Data has pokey nipples most if not all in the first few seasons. It‚Äôs not uncommon for tv and movies really. Not that entertainment is a good measure for normal but there‚Äôs clear evidence that some people don‚Äôt care. Or maybe I‚Äôm just weird for see hard nipples everywhere. Lol I‚Äôm just observant is all

Edit: NTA

>I am angry that I give them the power to constantly be the thing i am thinking about. I am angry that it has been years and I am not over it. 

I have experienced this. And my mom doesn‚Äôt actually love me either. You can read about my mom‚Äôs kind of crazy over at r/RaisedByNarcissists. I‚Äôm the good kind of crazy. I have issues I‚Äôm working on but I try to do good and be nice to people. Your comment about not wanting to be your mom makes me think the same applies to you. Simply being aware you don‚Äôt want to be that kind of person is great guidance into a different direction. 

Did therapy help? Is more therapy (with a different therapist) possible? I had to forgive myself for a whole lot of things. I‚Äôm just now getting into dealing with my own trauma in therapy and don‚Äôt have much I can share. It‚Äôs still very confusing to me. But just in case you need to hear it, you don‚Äôt have to forgive them. Any forgiveness is for your own peace. 

Maybe you can relate to my recent thoughts... I am trying to forgive myself for being hurt. For not dealing better. For not leaving childhood unscathed. For being weak and vulnerable. For being a kid. For basically being human. None of it is something I‚Äôve done wrong but it‚Äôs stuff I‚Äôve felt needlessly guilty for. I went through a version of hell so it‚Äôs no surprise I came out angry too. 

I‚Äôm sorry if I‚Äôm talking about myself too much. It‚Äôs just the way I communicate the ideas when I‚Äôm unsure how else to say it. Hang in there. With the obstacles you‚Äôve overcome and goals you‚Äôve reached and just looking for help somewhere ... I‚Äôm betting you‚Äôll figure it out.

Tele health is definitely different. I don‚Äôt like it but it‚Äôs better than the phone session I had the first week of the chaos. And it‚Äôs better than sitting around with my unhelpful thoughts. I hope you try it. Sometimes when there are no good solutions we have to do something we don‚Äôt want to do. Good thing is tele health can become more familiar and comfortable if you give it a chance. I still can‚Äôt wait for things to get closer to the normal of a month ago. Best wishes.

>He also sticks his paw in my mouth when I‚Äôm trying to sleep and he wants breakfast. They‚Äôre the best!

Reminds me of how I fell in love with my girl when she was puppy. Well, aside from being a puppy. She slept on my shoulder and drooled. She got me with her puppy drool lol 

edit: yes they are the best
Thanks :D

It kinda sucks when you don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs a need or a want. Check out OP‚Äôs response to my comment. There are tips to solve the problem. Also if I‚Äôm outside and I know my dog needs to potty but she keeps getting distracted, I say the potty command repeatedly. Every so often (30 seconds?) I‚Äôll shorten the leash so she has less freedom to get distracted. At some point she realizes that to keep sniffing she needs to listen to mom.
Thanks for sharing. Makes perfect sense.

I guess it depends on the dog maybe? I have been thinking about when I get my next puppy because its likely to happen eventually. I was thinking I could begin by ringing a bell and saying the potty command while she potties, but I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôll work any better. When I move the bell inside she may be conditioned to go at the sound while inside. Idk if that makes sense or not. This is actually what led me to join this sub. I‚Äôll figure it somehow so that it‚Äôs less likely to be misused. Seriously she drove me nuts lol. I have realized it‚Äôll be a good idea to have a puppy pad next to the bed or kennel from the very beginning, especially if I‚Äôm still in an apartment. Pad training is a must when you have outside stairs in cold and wet winters.

I did this with my beagle.  She learned the bell meant we‚Äôd go outside. Problem was that she wanted to be outside all the time. We would come back inside and she would sit next to the bell and hit it over and over. Drove me so nuts I had to take it down.

It is abusive for sure. I didn‚Äôt realize loving and caring parents were real. Like only fictional families on tv were like that. Until I spent time with my boyfriend‚Äôs parents. It‚Äôs so easy to be around them. Parents should help build up self esteem not break you down. Unfortunately some parents don‚Äôt work on their own issues and their issues lead to trauma for their children.

I‚Äôm going to own up to my own ignorance of the corona virus. I didn‚Äôt think it was ‚Äúso bad‚Äù either because I don‚Äôt watch the news. But I‚Äôve since been told to shelter in place by my governor and I‚Äôve been reading and I get it. I was wrong. As for the three posts, I replied to three different comments and I‚Äôm pretty sure they were all different users. Not that my judgement was correct or anything.

It‚Äôs understandable to be stressed by it. I guess growing up with my mom giving mixed messages caused me to not see how mixed messages aren‚Äôt ok. Because they really aren‚Äôt ok. You can‚Äôt say one thing and its opposite and both always be true. It‚Äôs worse than simply not communicating tho my mom does ignores me too. I didn‚Äôt even know I was receiving mixed messages all these years. I didn‚Äôt realize I gave mixed messages until someone told me. My childhood was pretty traumatic and I had to block out a lot in order to endure it. I rely on my mom a little bit financially but I‚Äôve definitely debated if it‚Äôs worth putting up with her bs. But the truth is I‚Äôm not ready to make the decision yet.

I think it‚Äôs part not wanting to deal with a sad kid so ‚Äúyou‚Äôre a genius‚Äù clears up that sadness. Or she doesn‚Äôt have any touch with reality as far as knowing what a genius is, who her daughter is, and the understanding that saying ‚Äúmaybe you aren‚Äôt good at this but you‚Äôre good at that‚Äù is a healthier option. Maybe it‚Äôs ignorance on her part, but I feel like she enjoys messing with my head. I was reading a lot of r/RaisedByNarcissists for a while. I‚Äôm pretty sure my mom hovers between BPD and narcissistic PD. But I‚Äôm not a professional so idk. Whatever the source (I likely will never know) it‚Äôs definitely unhealthy. The worst is when I call her out on something and she makes it my fault somehow. I‚Äôm kinda ranting at this point

I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôm right about this, but I sense there‚Äôs some invalidation you‚Äôre directing at yourself. Like you don‚Äôt deserve compassion for your struggles because you didn‚Äôt ‚Äúearn‚Äù them?? I also know it‚Äôs a nice idea for there to be a clear cause and effect about why we have mental problems. The not understanding why or feeling like I did it to myself somehow kind of drove me crazy for a long time. I definitely thought I didn‚Äôt deserve compassion. I thought I needed to try harder or toughen up or something else my jerk parents probably taught me to think. But that was lies even if they thought they were the truth. 

Mental illness is complicated for sure. It‚Äôs your responsibility to learn to manage it but you 100% deserve compassion regardless if you have a ‚Äúgood reason‚Äù to be depressed. The process of learning the skills to improve your life can be a little slow but you deserve compassion at all points of the journey. One of those skills I had to learn actually was compassion. It was tough but I went from very suicidal for many years to actually wanting to live. 

So I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs normal or not, but you‚Äôre not alone with the wish. I was there. And if my first paragraph seems way off I apologize. You just reminded me of my own thoughts from years ago. 

Remember to be kind to yourself.
Dog hair is guaranteed to be present too

I went to a friend with a situation thinking she could help me. Our moms are the same kind of crazy and my situation was mom related. She basically said my problem was petty (her word, not mine) and the only thing that matters is this virus. I called her out for being a jerk about a very real problem I thought she could relate to. She apologized and said she was distracted. If she would‚Äôve led with being distracted I would be fine with not getting support but instead she invalidated my experience and called it petty. She said these are not normal times but I don‚Äôt think it gives her the right to be a jerk. Maybe I‚Äôm also too sensitive but there are a few other times that I‚Äôve been miffed with her. This time it was just too much. OP, ultimately you have decide what actions to take regarding your friendship, but you‚Äôre definitely not alone in your emotional reaction. My reaction will be to pull away because I don‚Äôt want a friend that will be such a jerk - especially - when times are extra uncertain.
TV, movies, books... yes. If one dies I basically mourn the loss. Even with dogs as main characters like in A Dog‚Äôs Purpose. Sheesh, the waterworks.

Sometimes you can get free or cheap therapy through a church. It‚Äôs not necessarily religious-based, but it‚Äôs an avenue for people to give back to the community. And sometimes nonprofit mental health clinics can give reduced fee or free services also. I don‚Äôt know how you would find them but maybe google ‚Äúlocal nonprofit mental health‚Äù or something similar.
I read his birthday was the same (plus a year) and the grave was near his house. So growing up he would have seen a gravestone with his name and his birthday (of course the year was different).
I don‚Äôt mind crying in situations like this. I know it‚Äôs a good release and leading towards happier times.
I totally hear that. Thank goodness this didn‚Äôt happen a year ago.

I‚Äôm not sure that‚Äôs healthy. There needs to be respect for your experience in the relationship. I know my boyfriend doesn‚Äôt really understand my experience even when he says ‚ÄúI understand‚Äù, but I know he tries to understand and respects my experience. But admittedly I‚Äôm no relationship expert. I‚Äôm not sure why my boyfriend stuck around during the worst of it considering most of the good stuff happened later on.

I‚Äôm guessing they mean you were less inhibited on video chat vs face to face. I don‚Äôt agree with the idea. I‚Äôm lucky to have a therapist working from home now. Last week we talked on the phone. I don‚Äôt like talking on the phone at all. It was kinda awful. This week we video chatted. So so much better than just audio, but still uncomfortable. I know some discussions won‚Äôt happen until I can see her face to face again. I don‚Äôt like having to put progress on hold even if it is just a couple (big) things. But I‚Äôm definitely more inhibited on video chat.

>How smart that is. How Smart of a little girl to realize she can do that instead of experiencing the trauma full force. 

This hit me hard even if I‚Äôm just teary. I didn‚Äôt realize I thought little me was dumb for not handling things better but it makes sense. Me feeling dumb is one of my life‚Äôs themes. I‚Äôm only starting to realize my mom‚Äôs words (‚Äúyou‚Äôre a genius‚Äù) were the opposite of her behavior (being ridiculed for mistakes and her getting annoyed when I was too slow or clumsy). My perception of myself was split between the two extremes for a very long time. Yep I‚Äôm crying now.

Just to emphasize, OP... your health is more important than her fashion choices. Also, imo there‚Äôs no good reason to feel obligated to stay in a wedding party that makes you uncomfortable and doesn‚Äôt care that you‚Äôre made uncomfortable.
Sometimes we end up in the right place but have to try different routes before knowing how to get there. You didn‚Äôt fail. It‚Äôs just time for something else for now.
Might be saving his own life or those he could have passed the virus to.

You could answer that question with a question: Do you have 3 hours for me to explain? Some people might listen. It‚Äôs not at all the same and definitely not as hard to discuss, but I decided to tell a random nurse about how helpful my living situation is because (and I said this to her too) people don‚Äôt know how helpful programs like this can be to people like me.  (I live in housing for disabled people whose mental illness make living completely independently very difficult/impossible.)

My hope is that eventually abuse is seen for how it‚Äôs as devastating as assault. Maybe the evolution of perception starts with what is more easily seen as traumatic by people outside the experience. 

And I‚Äôm sorry people compound the problem with blaming/shaming.
That is one of the most beautiful videos I‚Äôve ever seen!
That was my thought. Like could it be classified as medically necessary if it will solve a host of problems?
Poor guy

I don‚Äôt disagree on the concern. Mostly my comment was because she‚Äôs not ridiculously over the top like most bridezillas described in this sub. Obviously everyone can decide for themselves if they want to attend. But the bride isn‚Äôt incredibly rude and abrasive imo

I don‚Äôt disagree on the concern. Mostly my comment was because she‚Äôs not ridiculously over the top like most bridezillas described in this sub. Obviously everyone can decide for themselves if they want to attend. But the bride isn‚Äôt incredibly rude and abrasive imo

I don‚Äôt disagree on the concern. Mostly my comment was because she‚Äôs not ridiculously over the top like most bridezillas described in this sub. Obviously everyone can decide for themselves if they want to attend. But the bride isn‚Äôt incredibly rude and abrasive imo

I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs overreacting. I think the panic is out of proportion to the problem. I mean, my town is basically out of toilet paper. What is that!?

Edit: I don‚Äôt disagree on the concern. Mostly my comment was because she‚Äôs not ridiculously over the top like most bridezillas described in this sub. Obviously everyone can decide for themselves if they want to attend. But the bride isn‚Äôt incredibly rude and abrasive imo

Wow. Forcing you to sign the check is effed up af. Soooooo NTA. I‚Äôm assuming your parents were pretty manipulative when alive too, and the people who are speaking against you are probably all enablers. 

To be fair, I‚Äôve been reading r/RaisedByNarcissists for the last hour, but I don‚Äôt see how there wasn‚Äôt a lot of other bs and potentially abusive behavior going on if your parents planned to manipulate you from the grave. 

People don‚Äôt know what they don‚Äôt know. The people speaking against your decisions haven‚Äôt been in your shoes, experienced your experiences, felt what you felt, but it doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre wrong at all. I‚Äôm just some internet stranger but I think you handled it perfectly.
I‚Äôm in the US and this was how my experience went.

That really doesn‚Äôt sound right. I don‚Äôt really have anything helpful to add about the specific situation but...

It can be just a diagnosis and not necessarily a disability. Many people with mental illness support themselves. On the other hand many people receive SSI because they can‚Äôt and have proven themselves as disabled. I‚Äôve heard of special accommodations but don‚Äôt know anything about them or the definition of disability in that context. 

I‚Äôve heard that once you‚Äôve been diagnosed bipolar, you always are bipolar, but the context may be important. I think this was mentioned when I was sharing that a new psychiatrist diagnosed me with depression rather than bipolar which had been my diagnosis before that point. But it may be completely different if you‚Äôre not being treated for bipolar and you are thriving. I‚Äôm not a doctor or any type of mental health professional. 

I really think they‚Äôre taking it way too far by requesting your records. Is there any way that not disclosing a past mental illness diagnosis could bite you in the butt later? I don‚Äôt know myself, but if there is a chance this comes up again in the future, it would be good to know. Heck, I‚Äôd like to know. But it‚Äôs not something that would be on xrays or lab tests so idk
I‚Äôm sorry your dad sucks so much.

Bad therapist or not, this doesn‚Äôt seem to be a good fit. At all. Wish I had something to offer but I expect it will be difficult if not impossible to urge your friend to see someone else. Perhaps you could google the therapist. Maybe there‚Äôs a pattern of clients regressing. Idk where you‚Äôd go from there but it is the only action I can think of. 

That said, I actually got a whole lot worse in some ways before I got better. It can be part of the process but I‚Äôve been part of the extreme end of mentally ill. I‚Äôm on disability. I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs why my journey was like that.

Drugs (as in medications) don‚Äôt make people weaker. Maybe the guy is having a bad reaction to the medication or it is interacting with the edibles. But to say medications are bad, well, they help a lot of people who need them.

Try looking for a not for profit community mental health clinic. I‚Äôve had several caring therapists but all of them were at such a place. The ones at private practices definitely seemed more concerned about money. It‚Äôs not a rule either way (not for profit doesn‚Äôt guarantee caring and private practice isn‚Äôt devoid of caring) but maybe the probability increases? It‚Äôs just my experience to have a lot of success with caring therapists at that type of clinic. Though I had to wade through a couple crappy ones too.

I believe therapy can be much more than ‚Äúpaying for a friend‚Äù (as I‚Äôve heard some clients‚Äô experiences seem to be) and if finding irl friends is an issue a good therapist should help to find healthy friendships.
She was illustrating her patience and kindness by identifying what she could have done.
Maybe she knew they were empty threats but thought intimidation might work. Or thought she was speaking to someone dumber than her

I think they are oblivious that they are avoiding their own feelings of inferiority. They can‚Äôt stand the idea they‚Äôre not perfect so they do anything to convince themselves they are. There‚Äôs also a feeling of being justified in seeking revenge. I‚Äôm not sure they are unaware of it but don‚Äôt care about who they hurt.

I can confirm. I knew something was very wrong before I had any idea what it was. Could see some of my actions I knew weren‚Äôt right but the big feelings behind them, the confusion about what was happening, and the complete lack of knowing what else to do about it prevented changing on my own. Lots of therapy later, I have self awareness and am very different. I believe that my bpd was learned via trauma. I thought I‚Äôve read personality disorders generally are learned but I‚Äôm not a professional.
Do you use laundry detergent?
Oh nice having a second rod!

I would hope there wasn‚Äôt judgment behind the question. There‚Äôs no requirement to get it on by a particular age, just maybe a tendency for people to have sex during a certain stage of development. Not all lives look the same.
This works in many ways.
Thanks for sharing
Can children get a parent in trouble?

Rules for military discounts vary from place to place with some including family members but usually only with ID.
